title: Synthetic Recap
body:
ATLANTA – On a night that belonged to one man, the Atlanta Hawks rode a superhuman performance into the record books. Dikembe Mutombo, the league’s premier defensive force, authored a stat line so absurd it defied belief, powering the Hawks to a 117-105 victory over the Washington Bullets.

Mutombo was not merely a participant; he was a force of nature. The 7-foot-2 center delivered a performance for the ages, amassing a staggering **31 points, 19 rebounds, and 4 blocks**. He was an immovable object in the paint, converting with ruthless efficiency and controlling the glass with an iron will. Every Washington foray into the lane was met with the looming specter of his outstretched arms, turning the Hawks’ key into a no-fly zone.

While Mutombo’s dominance was the headline, he received vital support. Christian Laettner provided a smooth 20 points, and Steve Smith orchestrated the offense with 18 points and 11 assists, many of which found a wide-open Mutombo at the rim.

The Bullets, despite a valiant 25-point effort from Chris Webber and 22 points from Tracy Murray, had no answer for the Atlanta juggernaut. They were simply overwhelmed by a historic individual effort that transcended the flow of the game.

On this night, the final score was almost a footnote. The real story was etched in the box score next to one name: Dikembe Mutombo. In a legendary display of two-way dominance, he didn't just win a game; he authored a masterpiece that will echo through the annals of Hawks history.
